publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4219 Pauline McNeill: Scottish Curry Awards 2009—That the Parliament recognises the Irn-Bru Scottish Curry Awards 2009 as an opportunity to celebrate the success of the Indian restaurant sector in Scotland; acknowledges Glasgow’s contribution to the sector; congratulates Ali Ahmed Aslam, founder of the Shish Mahal, originally in Gibson Street in the city, whose proceeds from his own cook book are donated to the Prince and Princess of Wales Hospice, on receiving the Lifetime Achievement Award; also congratulates Balbir Singh Sumai, owner of Balbir’s in Glasgow’s west end, who is dynamic in his approach to the industry, introducing healthly eating into Indian cuisine, an initiative recognised at the Scottish Government Healthy Living Awards earlier this year, on receiving the Curry King of the Year Award, and also congratulates the Ashoka Elderslie on its Team of the Year Award.

S3M-4219 Scottish Curry Awards 2009 (lodged on 21 May 2009) Dr Richard Simpson*, Margaret Curran*, John Lam ont*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Sarah Boyack*, Claire Baker*, John Park*, Mary Mulligan*, Helen Eadie*, Elaine Murray*, George Foulkes*, Hugh Henry*, Cathy Jam ieson*, Ken Macintosh*, Jackie Baillie*, Andy Kerr*, Jam ie Hepburn*, Jam ie McGrigor*, Karen Whitefield*, Bob Doris*
S3M-4219 Scottish Curry Awards 2009 (lodged on 21 May 2009) Karen Gillon*, Robin Harper*, Gil Paterson*, Trish Godman*
S3M-4219 Scottish Curry Awards 2009 (lodged on 21 May 2009) Jack McConnell*, Stuart McMillan*
S3M-4219 Scottish Curry Awards 2009 (lodged on 21 May 2009) Marilyn Livingstone*
